explanation: In the passage you're referring to, Exodus 7:1, when the Lord says to Moses, "See, I make you as God to Pharaoh, and Aaron your brother shall be your prophet," Aaron is assigned the role of a prophet, not a priest. text: Which of the following names was given to Solomon by the prophet Nathan when he was born?
explanation:
The name Jedidiah was given to Solomon by the prophet Nathan, and it carries a significant meaning. The event is recorded in 2 Samuel 12:24-25. Here's a brief explanation:
After King David committed adultery with Bathsheba and arranged for her husband Uriah to be killed, the prophet Nathan confronted David with his sin. As a consequence of David's actions, the child born to him and Bathsheba became ill and eventually died.
After the child's death, Solomon was born later, and the name Jedidiah ("beloved of the Lord") was given to him by the prophet Nathan (2 Samuel 12:24-25). The naming of Solomon as Jedidiah served as a reminder of God's love and grace even in the midst of the consequences of David's wrongdoing. It emphasizes that God had a special and affectionate purpose for Solomon, who would later become known for his wisdom and play a crucial role in the construction of the temple in Jerusalem.

text: And God said "Ask what I shall give you" To whom and where was this request made?
explanation: The request "Ask what I shall give you" was made to Solomon and it happened at Gibeon. This account is found in 2 Chronicles 1:7-12 (RSV). Solomon, after offering sacrifices at the high place in Gibeon, had a dream in which God appeared to him and granted him the opportunity to request anything he desired. Solomon asked for wisdom, and God not only granted him wisdom but also wealth and honour.

explanation: Elijah ran from Mount Carmel to the city of Jezreel because he was pursued by Ahab the king. This incident is described in 1 King 18-19, where Elijah, after confronting the prophets of Baal on Mount Carmel, hears that Ahab's wife, Jezebel, intends to kill him. text: Proclaim a fast and set Naboth on high among the people. Which of the following was Naboth charged with after the proclamation? He was charged with

options.A: claiming to be the messiah and king
options.D: refusing to release the family land to the king

explanation: Naboth was falsely charged with cursing God and the king after the proclamation to proclaim a fast and set him on high among the people. This incident is recorded in 1 Kings 21, where King Ahab desired Naboth's vineyard, but Naboth refused to sell or exchange it as it was his family inheritance. Jezebel, Ahab's wife, then plotted to have Naboth falsely accused and stoned to death thereby clearing the way for Ahab to take possession of the vineyard.

text: Jesus' call of the first four disciples to be "fishers of men" implied that they were to
explanation: When Jesus called the first four disciples—Simon Peter, Andrew, James, and John—to be "fishers of men," it implied that they were to propagate the teachings of Jesus. The metaphor of fishing for men suggests that they were to go out and bring people into the community of believers, spreading the message of Jesus and inviting others to follow him. This call emphasized the disciples' role in evangelism and spreading the Gospel.

text: The replacement of Judas Iscariot was necessary because the

options.A: death of Judas Iscariot was premature
options.B: twelve disciples represented the twelve tribes of Israel
options.C: prophesies of the scripture needed to be fulfilled
options.D: status quo of the twelve must be maintained

explanation:
According to Acts 1:15-26, the replacement of Judas Iscariot was necessary to fulfil the Scriptures. The disciples believed that it was in line with the prophetic writings of the Old Testament, particularly Psalms 69:25 and 109:8, which were quoted in Acts 1:20 (RSV):
20 For it is written in the book of Psalms,
‘Let his habitation become desolate,and let there be no one to live in it’;
and
‘His office let another take.’
These passages were interpreted as foretelling the need for another to replace Judas among the apostles.
